website_summaries.verdict: The Ideal pet door is an affordable alternative to professionally installed pet doors. Overall, it's the best on the market right now.
pros: Can be adjusted for larger pets
Magnets and floating sill provide solid closure
cons: Plastic connections and framing have durability issues

customer_reviews.title: The "telescoping frame" is NOT included as per the title ...
customer_reviews.text: The "telescoping frame" is NOT included as per the title would indicate. It's just a pair of cheap plastic trim with a flap in the middle. False advertising, and for anyone who wants to argue show me ONE telescope that you bought online and the front and rear lenses were delivered and the middle is "sold separately". DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: This pet door "Ruff-Weather" designation is a misnomer. The ...
customer_reviews.text: This pet door "Ruff-Weather" designation is a misnomer. The double flaps hardly ever meet the magnets and leaves gaps between the flaps so that the cold freely enters the house. I would have tried the Pet Safe Extreme Weather Energy Efficient Pet door, but it does not come in an extra large size which is what I need for my two large dogs. If I had to do it all over again, I would have saved money and gotten a regular pet door for a lot less.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Very weather proof
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this door for several years, and now we are in the teeth of a blizzard, 40+ mph winds and blowing snow. This morning there was not a snowflake in the sun room. The pet door in in the big door to the outside, and it has always functioned perfectly. This door replaced a single flap unit that always blew open during windy rain and snow storms. I worried the cats would hesitate to use the twin flaps, but they adapted in a very short time. As a extremely pleased owner of this door, I offer you my highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: tpmazz

customer_reviews.title: and this actually wasn't too bad. I did have a little bit of trouble ...
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid of installing a pet door in a metal door, and this actually wasn't too bad. I did have a little bit of trouble lining up the holes, and broke one of the screw mounting stems on the inside part of the door (I ended up jury rigging something out of the door metal to clamp the outside tight). It took about a week to train the dogs to use the door, but now they love it. Bottom line is that the installation was somewhat difficult, but the door seems to work well - we will see how well it seals when the snow starts to fly...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the x-large door for our two dachshunds and Portuguese water dog. One of the little girls was hesitant at first just due to the double flap but with a little coaxing it was not a problem. The flaps are heavy but they do just fine with it. This door is very well assembled and super easy to install. We replaced another brand door and this one seems significantly better quality. Also, I wanted to say that this door is quiet upon the pets entering and exiting the home. I love it thus far!
customer_reviews.author: AMY DUBOSE

customer_reviews.title: Stop holding the door for a cat that can't decide whether to come or go
customer_reviews.text: One of our cats is smart enough to use it; the other, notsomuch (the only cat I've ever had that simply would not train to a cat door). Can't fault the manufacturer for that! This door looks good, is durable, keeps out the weather, and gives you the freedom to stop holding doors for your pet.
customer_reviews.author: LoveFactually author

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Dog Door!
customer_reviews.text: This doggie door was the perfect answer for our dogs! I had another brand and the plastic flaps were obscure and my dogs were afraid to go thru the door. The Ruff Weather door has high quality vinyl that in very clear. My dogs have trained to use it by the end of the first day. They actually enjoy going in and out on their own. We are all so pleased with our purchase and this product! Thank you Ruff Weather their is no other doggie door that even comes close to the quality of yours! 🐶😃
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what else someone would ask for in a doggie door... I'm an engineer and I give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what more someone would ask for in a doggie door... good construction, easy installation (assuming you are comfortable cutting a hole in your door), the flaps seal very well due to magnetic stops, and looks pretty nice also. There is a seal on the outside edge which would work just fine for a flat/smooth door, but if you have a panel door you will need some silicone (or similar) sealant. Add it after the installation. Only takes a few min.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great for big boi woofers. Easy to install with right tools.
customer_reviews.text: Great dog door. Installed it onto my new door and was wildly impressed by the quality and magnetic seals. It was crazy expensive but that's just good dog doors in general from the looks of it. I would recommend not using a jigsaw like the instructions call for, as it takes way longer and you need a longer than average blade. I used a fine tooth, all material blade on my reciprocating saw. Because I was careful it saved me alot of headache and time. Hopefully the flaps stand up to the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Zalan

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Door Ever
customer_reviews.text: Best pet door ever. Dogs took right it. The double flaps are heavy duty and installation was easy - way easier than I anticipated. One major storm one evening, blowing right at the house, pushed the flaps open so some rain came in, but the easy in barrier stopped it no problem. We don't often see gusts over 20mph, but we did that day. The magnetic closure works well and after the gust, the flaps sealed back in place, no problem. But the easy-in flap barrier stopped it cold - and it keeps the dogs in or out as desired whenever needed.
customer_reviews.author: skip

customer_reviews.title: Great for our dogs - Super Large size
customer_reviews.text: We were skeptical about ordering such a large and deep dog door, but it turned out to be exactly what we needed. We have two large and two medium sized dogs and so far this door has held up nicely. We purchased the Super Large size to hopefully accommodate our Mastiff when she's fully grown. The dual flaps do a great job of keeping out the weather and it only took a few minutes for all four dogs to figure out how to use it. We actually installed this in a metal storm door so we would still have our primary door to close and lock if needed. Installation was quick and easy with the provided template.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: just a suggestion for the design
customer_reviews.text: The only negative thing I would say about this item is that it doesn't handle the wind speeds we get often in southwest Idaho. I would like to have a small two inch magnetic area halfway down the sides of this door to help keep it from bowing-in during the winter when our weather pattern comes from the northwest. I have occasion to use the hard plastic insert; however I inevitably wind up locking a cat or two outside while the dogs are inside staying dry and warm.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, did not last very long
customer_reviews.text: This dog door was installed to replace the previous single flap dog door which was starting to allow outside air in after 6 years. Both flaps on the new door have become hopelessly warped after less than 1 year and the slightest breeze will push the flaps inward allowing the free flow of outside air into the house. I have readjusted both flaps several times to align them to the frame but the holes in the top of the flaps have stretched out and can no longer be aligned to fit the frame correctly.
customer_reviews.author: B L Dilley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to keep unwanted bigger critters out
customer_reviews.text: Needed a solution to replace a bigger pet door that would allow access for my cat to a kennel without allowing raccoons in. Was tired of trapping raccoons & was worried about my cat getting cornered inside the kennel. Installed this higher on the wall & added a shelf on both sides so the cat could jump up, land, & enter the building. Apparently Raccoons can’t jump..So far success! Also, I have a big cat..Maine Coon..that is indoor/outdoor & it is a snug fit with his winter coat
customer_reviews.author: Karen Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased for 12lb -20lb. doggies... might be too much for a cat. Well made!
customer_reviews.text: Well designed and made out of good material. Easily screwed together. There is some forgiveness in how you cut the door since there is a good overlap of the frame around the opening. The front and back pieces fit together very well. Seems solid and am very happy to use. Keeps out the cold VERY well and even our lightest dog (12lb. Boston Terrier) can push through the doors. Might not be a good solution for a cat since the air gap/fit requires some amount of strength and body weight to open. Happy with purchase and the included template for cutting (my metal and foam core door) was easy with a jig saw!
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Heaitate. It is worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This door is tough. Very sturdy, seals well. What we ever did without it I don’t know! We have five dogs ranging in size from 50-100 lbs. the smallest one has a little trouble pushing it open but she does it . the big dogs have no trouble. This Extra Large Door is perfect for all of them. Rather than cut up our good door we bought a used one and my husband cut it to fit. Just could not be happier. Wish we had bought it sooner. At night we just add the door to shut it. It easily slides over the flap.
customer_reviews.author: rrkelly

customer_reviews.title: Regretful purchase
customer_reviews.text: I live in North Dakota. This is the first winter with this dog door. I mostly just keep it clothes and don't use it. Very disappointing. If it is colder than 20 degrees the plastic doors stiffen up and the magnets that are suppose to seal it across the bottom don't reach because they are stiff and crumpled they don't pull straight down to grab magnet when this cold. The door is installed in a heated porch. This is the largest size I could find. so it worked with my large dog and smaller dog. But I feel I am better off with out a dog door. Now.
customer_reviews.author: b boschee

customer_reviews.title: The magnets on the bottom of the flaps are great so far (been 2 months)
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what i wanted! I modified this to fit on my screened door to enter/exit the pool. This doggy Door is a bit heavy, which required me to replace the screen/metal on the bottom with wood, then spray painted black to match the door. The magnets on the bottom of the flaps are great so far (been 2 months). The best part is waking up in the morning or evening, opening my sliding glass door to let the dogs out without worrying about bugs coming in! A+ would buy again. I have referred this product to friends and family because of how easy it was to install
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Burnett

customer_reviews.title: We have 3 large dogs and they love it now
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 large dogs and they love it now. At first only 2 would go through it but slowly had to train the other. This is REALLY large! We have 1 lg pit, a smaller one and a lab. I can fit through it, j/s. It was easy to install. We bought the one that goes through a wall. Definitely get the pet door installation kit that is optional to buy. Anyhow - I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Rehders

customer_reviews.title: Horrible lake effect winters
customer_reviews.text: Southern Michigan here. Horrible lake effect winters. This was a challenge to installl, not the doors fault, but because of my unique wall thickness. I have 2 X 6 walls with a layer of plywood, layer of 1/2" thick mylar coated insulation over plywood, then 1 1/2" log siding over that . The door itself works great . KEEPS MORE COLD AIR OUT THAN ANY DOGGIE DOOR i'VE EVER HAD! I did buy the inner extension and sealed it with silicone. My stafford shire terrier was a little hesitant at first. But she's smart and got it within a couple of days. It is now early January and it's handling winter well.
customer_reviews.author: steve w.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Installed into the wall. So far, the flaps have stayed closed nicely. Fairly easy to install. It is really important to keep everything level and don't over-tighten the screws or it seems to warp the plastic and the slide in door won't fit as well. I'm going to ad some caulking to it for better waterproofing but haven't had any issues with leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not energy efficient.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this door because of the "energy efficient" double flaps. There is a gap on both sides of each flap that just lets air right past. Poor engineering.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny as long as your dog isn't dumb.
customer_reviews.text: Quality gets an A, installation gets an A, but my wife's dog gets an F. She is too dumb to use it. Meanwhile my cat that is also dumb figured out how to get through it. The dog will bark at it like it's going to open itself while the cat says "F*** YOU..., I'm going outside to hump a squirrel". I assume that once the bitch sees the cat go through it enough she will eventually follow him to freedom but for now we have to hold the flaps open for her.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy install!
customer_reviews.text: Well built door. Simple instructions and template. Only complaint is that the dual doors tend to get magnetically stuck to each other so it keeps one open and allows drafts into the house. Bought the medium size and it is perfect for my 12 lb miniature schnauzer. It took her about 10 min to figure it out. I have a raised panel door and was able to get a good seal with some caulking. Toughest part was lining up the drill holes for the screws, but aside from that, it was pretty simple.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dorais

customer_reviews.title: This door does everything you want and more. Durable, easy to install, great insulating properties
customer_reviews.text: Flaps are durable and well built, magnetic strip on the bottom is very strong and holds the flaps in place. You can remove the screws in the bar that holds the flap in place so that you can easily clean the flap on both sides and reinstall in less than a minute. They also have replacement flaps and parts so you can use this door for years. I have a large German Shepherd and a Doberman, there is plenty of room for them to go in and out. This door also helps keep the outdoor temperature, flies and bugs outdoor.
customer_reviews.author: Christine E. Thomason

customer_reviews.title: looks great, easier to install than the other 2 doggie ...not so great with winter
customer_reviews.text: looks great, easier to install than the other 2 doggie doors I've put in. Some of the weather stripping has come off (but to be fair my puppy may have helped with that). So far no leaks and we've had some pretty heavy rain, only time will tell how it fairs with winter weather!...**UPDATE** now that winter is here, the door is not so great. The inner door never fully closes so cold air is constantly coming in. Also if there is any wind at all the doors will blow open. Needs a stronger magnet to hold the doors closed.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Quality dog door
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality dog door. I give it 4 for a couple of reasons. I installed this in a wall, and it did not come with the screws for this. Also, the template for marking the screw holes was off by over an inch. I had to get creative to finish the project. For this price you should get everything you need. That being said, it was not difficult to put in and I am very happy with end results.
customer_reviews.author: araknetoo

customer_reviews.title: So glad I got this!
customer_reviews.text: I got this along with the wall installation to go in wall off my deck/dining room. My handy man was able to easily install it and said he will recommend this brand to any customers who need a doggy door installed. My Berner Mr. Bear caught on quickly and thanks me every time he comes in with a kiss on the cheek! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good quality as the one (Pet Safe Extreme Weather) we ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as good quality as the one (Pet Safe Extreme Weather) we replaced for a larger door. We lost thermal/ extreme weather flaps that added better protection from outside. Flaps are not thick on this door nor are they tinted to keep out most of the daylight. Shame to think it's not keeping cold in or hot out. My suggestion would be make thicker flaps for better coverage. If my dog wasn't Extra Large then I would have never switched. My heat & Ac just keep running & my bill has even went up. I would not buy another or recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Nice durable pet door. I wish the door cover was a little better made. My big dog can actually run right through it and knock it out. She has a hard head! It didn't break the door. So I ordered another door for the front. I don't be think she could run through it. I wonder if someone could kick it in though and break in to the house.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is a good value and decent door
customer_reviews.text: Only x large door I could find at a reasonable price. It is a good value and decent door, but The wall kit I purchased with it really sucks. Dont pay attention to the instructions that come with the wall kit, when it comes to trimming it to the correct width. Incorrect and misleading instructions caused me to cut it to thin. Putting it in the wall was quite a chore to get the holes all lined up too. Wish someone would just make an adjustable door that is ready to wall mount.
customer_reviews.author: QAZ

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, like the clear panels
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than the other brand I purchased for my large dog door. Because I installed it on an exterior wall, there is a bit of a "tunnel" for my cats to go through. But the very clear panels made it really easy for them to learn (they had trouble with the "smoky" panels of another brand) and the insert that I had to purchase to "telescope" this is really sturdy so the cats are using it just fine. It's a well made product, looks good in the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: This doggy has been a great addition for my hounds
customer_reviews.text: This doggy has been a great addition for my hounds. I purchased the largest one as I have two Italian mastiffs and it is plenty big for them. Took them a little bit of time to get used to the double flaps as it is their first doggy door but they finally got the hang of it. I like how this door has two flaps for a better insulating barrier oppose to just one flap. It also has a weather stripping liner on the outside half for a weather barrier. Installing this door was a breeze and I had it all done in less then 30 minutes. Overall very happy.
customer_reviews.author: brandon birtch

customer_reviews.title: The double flag works great at keeping out the cold air
customer_reviews.text: I looked at numerous doors before choosing this one. The double flag works great at keeping out the cold air. Both my labs had no issues at learning to go through the double flap vs a single flap door. The inside and outside portions are a bit bulky, but they seem sturdy. I did need to purchase the wall kit to install this in my outside wall. Additionally make sure you frame out the opening so the bottom is supported. The wall kit extension is made of thin plastic that wouldn't be able to hold the weight of the 80lb if the bottom wasn't supported.
customer_reviews.author: rsw686

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This door is really easy to install and well made. We have a little schnauzer terrier mix (15 lbs), ordered the medium door and it is perfect for her. Additionally, since we have a dark brown/black door, we spray painted it black so it wouldn't stick out. With the instructions they provided, our dog learned to use it within an hour. What really helped was taping one of the flaps up at first so she could get used to going through just one flap. Our tape didn't hold and by the following morning the second flap had dropped but she went through it anyway. So nice not having to wait at the door while she does her business!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The best pet door I've bought.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best pet door I ever bought and I've bought and installed several over the years. It was easy to install with the right tools and a little bit of preview and pre-planning. I'd recommend getting the outdoor "cover" (roof/hood) if you're in a windy, wet area or the pet door faces the windward side of the house. Make sure it's sealed properly, follow the directions and you and your pets will be all giggly and happy in the end. Okay... maybe just happy. I don't think pets giggle. Though it can be argued...
customer_reviews.author: D. H.

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this pet door...good quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dog door. The double panels with the magnetic latches help keep out the outside temperatures and weather conditions. It has been a life saver for us, or should I say our knees. It seemed as if the two dogs that we have always needed to go outside just after we had sat down. And now we don't have to rush home to let them out. We didn't want to cut a hole in our wall just in case this door didn't work out so we installed it into a piece of plywood we cut to fit inside the window frame and then locked the window into position. It has worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: mumma52

customer_reviews.title: Great doggie door
customer_reviews.text: I would have given 5 stars but the template that came with the doggie door is incorrect. Thankfully my husband knew how to fix the problem. So I recommend not using the template that comes with it. But the doggie door works great. Even my cats are able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Nice door
customer_reviews.text: This installed nicely with the wall kit. I had to cut a hole in the exterior siding and the inside drywall, which was easy with a $20 jig saw. Make sure you have a hack saw, or something, available to cut the bolts to the correct size. Also, do yourself a favor and watch the 4-part installation video on youtube as you are installing. It's easier than following the written instructions. The double doors seal well - the summer air is barely noticeable so far. My 9 week old britt puppy goes through it no problem. The 8 year old shorkie isn't sold on it yet, but he goes through for treats. No problems so far. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: idcuda

customer_reviews.title: works great for our scared-of-everything dogs
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 mixed breed dogs that are scared of everything (will take a few attempts to go through narrow gaps and partially opened doors) so was very doubtful that they would ever use this door of their own accord. To our surprise, after about 4 passes through the door under the influence of biscuit bribery and much sweet talking they both started using it with no incentives and without hesitation. have now had 2 doors for half a year - very easy to install, no issues with closing, I did buy extra large even though my dogs are only 39lbs each because i was so worried about their fear of narrow entrances
customer_reviews.author: Camilala

customer_reviews.title: Great double insulated flaps work well to keep cold out and give dog ability to come and go as he pleases Size chart good
customer_reviews.text: Love having a dog door makes my life teacher at my dogs happier. Really recommend the double weather flaps especially where I live we have all four seasons easy to install easy to clean. dog and owner really happy. Great sturdy well built double insulated flaps work well to keep cold out and give dog ability to come and go as he pleases. Size chart is good based off dog measurements size
customer_reviews.author: Logan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I ever did for our dog!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to install in our exterior wall of our home. I used the template that was included to make my marks. It cut out and fit perfect. I used some small pieces of 2x4 for framing inside the wall. I guess they make a kit specifically for wall installations so that is also an option. It worked great! The dog is happy and not scratching the door to go out 45 minutes before your alarm is supposed to go off now!
customer_reviews.author: shar

customer_reviews.title: Love this door
customer_reviews.text: We have a German Shepherd and a Labrador mix. Perfect size for these dogs. Bought the super. Wish they had one size between the super and large. Needed this one for width. Very easy for dogs to use. Love the two flaps. We have it upstairs near our living room and I was worried about the cold air. Does a great job of keeping cold air out. The cover for the flaps is plastic and so much better than the ply board with our old doggie door. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: This is by far my favorite dog door - but I've never owned any other ...
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my favorite dog door - but I've never owned any other product. I've moved 3 times and bought this product in 2 different sizes. It's easy to follow the instructions and install, with little experience. If you're installing it in a stucco frame wall - you'll likely need the extender kit and probably need to cut the screws down. That was the challenging part, but otherwise, it wasn't bad. But the product itself holds up through constant wear and tear with 3 dogs charging through it! the 2 flaps help keep the weather outside which is great! I just love this door.
customer_reviews.author: Kim McElroy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality product, easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before purchasing a dog door. This door comes with metal screws (most other brands had plastic), a double flap, and a slide in closure panel. Once we had the hole cut in the metal door, the installion was very easy. I ordered XL for my doberman (78lbs, 27in shoulder) and he fits through easily. I don't feel any cold air coming through the flaps, and the magnetic strips hold the flaps securely. I would highly recommend this product or reorder if I need another!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flaps too stiff
customer_reviews.text: The flaps are too stiff. This has two bad effects: 1) the flaps do not seal in cold weather, allowing a lot of cold air into the house; and 2) our little dog cannot push through the flaps in cold weather. We have the small size, where this problem would be most extreme, I think.
customer_reviews.author: Davecarte

customer_reviews.title: It was fairly easy to put in (took me and my husband maybe ...
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how quickly our dog understood how to use it. We installed it this weekend and she is coming in and out with no problem. It was fairly easy to put in (took me and my husband maybe 45 min). I really like how the two doors snap back into place right away so bugs and hot air can't get in. No complaints so far!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay D O'Steen

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: This is the 5th one I've installed for friends after having it in my home(s) for years. The double flap really does the job on cold air, sub-zero winters, and hot summer, 80's and 90's. Will keep the weather and strong winds out and is suitable for installing directly into your living areas (kitchens, bed rooms, living room to name a few that I have put in). Install is simple, just follow instructions and be careful not to tear up the supplied paper template when you unpack the door. The expense/cost is consistent with the quality and serviceability of the Ruff-Weather doors.
customer_reviews.author: JADroste0215

customer_reviews.title: Excellent dog door for all weather
customer_reviews.text: We installed this in a door last fall and went through the winter comfortably. Installation is relatively easy if you are handy. As one reviewer suggested, I removed one of the panels for training. One dog immediately took to the door without any issues when shown how -- she'll do anything for food. The other surprised me and resisted for almost a week. I took lots of patience and encouragement. I didn't replace the second panel until after both dogs were successfully negotiating through. (It's too bad it doesn't also come in a brown color -- I had to paint mine and some parts are not reachable.)
customer_reviews.author: richlife

customer_reviews.title: Bought the double flap door.
customer_reviews.text: Had the single flap door for many years. Replaced it with the double flap door. Really like it. Not so much drafting. Better weather protection. Recommend it. Have tried several other pet doors and I think this is the best out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install in my existing steel door (top half windows, bottom half solid). I considered buying a different brand that was aluminum and would be flush to door. However, my door gets a lot of afternoon sun so I thought the aluminum would get too hot. This one isn't the most attractive, but it works as described...lets my dog in/out and keeps cold air out. My dog loves having mostly unrestricted access to backyard. I love that I can put the cover in and keep her in the house when the yard guys are here.
customer_reviews.author: BelleAmeTx

customer_reviews.title: Nice door!
customer_reviews.text: It worked very well for an active indoor-outdoor cat. I bought the wall extension and placed the door through a wall on a less windy side because, even though the flaps have magnets, we get 50 MPH winds often in the winter rains and this wouldn't hold up to that. I spent a week cutting through our stucco and underlying wire, making the interior and exterior holes level, patching and painting the spot in the stucco where I made the hole to big, and caulking around the exterior and the wall extension. A week later our cat ran off, never to return.
customer_reviews.author: Dude Out West

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy product. We have an obese lab that is very old and can hardly get around good but she goes in and out with no difficulty. We also have a three month old australian shepherd puppy that caught on how to get in and out very quickly. We have pinned one side up to get them used to going through before we leave both flaps down. A bit of work was required for installation but nothing we couldn't handle with a reciprocating saw. You must buy the inner Channel separately. This is going to make our animals alot happier and us too. Recommend to anyone with animals.
customer_reviews.author: 29again

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Installed this three months ago for two Jack Russels. I started with only one of the flaps installed to have the doggies get used to the door. The first one figured in out in minutes, but the other took almost two months before had the courage go through the door on her own. Even with one flap installed it kept the cool out pretty well Later on I added the second flap as well and it works nicely. No draft and the doggies go through it with no major porblems. I've noticed that when weather gets cold the flaps somewhat stiffen and my less-brave dog sometimes hesitates before coming through. All in all happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sihvonen

customer_reviews.title: Overall one of the best, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good product, but it doesn't come with the tunnel to connect the two halves of the door. I must not have read the description carefully enough. I ended up making the tunnel out of sheet metal just so I could finish the job. In very high winds, the magnetic seal will blow open, letting air or potentially water in or out of your house, but this is a rare occurrence. The dogs seem to like it and only took them a few days to learn. Very sturdy and seems like it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: George W.

customer_reviews.title: Great All Weather Pet Door
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this pet door for over two months and it is GREAT. My dog can come and go as he pleases and I may even be happier than he is since I don't have to worry about him when I have to work a little OT and I don't have to get up until I have to pee now! On a really windy day, the inside flap does move sometimes, but I have not felt any draft by the door. Installation wasn't terrible, if you don't know what you are doing, then pay someone who does. The manufacturer website has some good videos and their tech support seems to be ok too. Why didn't I do this sooner?
customer_reviews.author: RonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this door to fit a Rottweiler and 2 large Mutts. I have had no problems so far. The door is intended to be put into a door or wall but I ended up placing it in a window. I love it! They do sell specific window units but none large enough for my needs. The double flaps work well to protect from the elements. I live in Florida and it keeps the bugs and heat out. My dogs were skittish at first as the magnets are very strong, but they had it mastered in no time. Great doggy door.
customer_reviews.author: Eclectic Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Looks good.  Purchased the medium size.
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit of a pain for hubby to install and he's a carpenter. The screws are cheap and easily stripped. He had to make a trip to hardware store. We wanted it to keep my daughters huge Mastiff dogs out when she visits yet give my small dogs the freedom to get back in. Its hard to believe but her Mastiff's can army crawl through the door. Grr..I love that you can slide the panel down and shut it completly. We added insulation around it before putting the trim on. You will have to shove/push your dog through several times and reward with treats to get them comfortable with door. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: OliveOily

customer_reviews.title: It fits fine and looks nice
customer_reviews.text: It fits fine and looks nice. The dual flaps are nice but need to be heavier with stronger magnets. If the wind is blowing outside the outside flap is all over the place and sometimes enough that the inside flap is moving also. I live in S. Calif. and am close to the beach so it can get windy, but if in an area of real weather, not sure how the flaps would be working absent some type of wind shield outside to protect it a bit. Also, my dog is not okay with it, but initially after having a single flap for years, was kind of scared about going thru with the second flap.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Trott

customer_reviews.title: I'd give this product 10 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that this is a very thoughtfully-designed and well-made product -- the manufacturer can be proud of what they produced. My dog was a little reluctant to use it at first -- so here is what I did. First, I removed the inside door (very easy to do) ... then I put painter's tape at the bottom of the outer door, so that the magnetic pull was a little weaker, making the door easier to open. My dog really liked the door and started using it regularly -- and now I have removed the painter's tape. Eventually I'll re-install the inner door. We are very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Needs to be in a covered area. We installed in a door that wasn't in a covered area and had to watch for hard rain getting through, even with the double doors.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth G Todd

customer_reviews.title: Happy pets!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 20lb terrier mix and a cat. I am very happy with this gate. They learned how to use it very fast. I installed it with no flaps for a few days, then one flap and then both flaps as they got used to it. The flaps stay down so not much air comes in. My dog is beagle size and this size (M) is fine for her but if your dog is any bigger consider ordering a size up.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. We installed it for our large tall boxer 95lbs, a Catahoula 85lbs, and a chow mix 65lbs. This thing works great. Took a little teaching bc this does connect the doubles flaps at bottom with magnets to keep flaps closed. But the dogs now love it and go thru no problem. Not sure if the cat can. He's too pansy to try it so far. Definitely keeps the cold air out. Impressively keeps it out. Totally worth the money. Hubby said it was easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Soli

customer_reviews.title: Excellent insulated doggie door. Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This is my first doggie door and I have to say that I am impressed and happy with this purchase. Living in AZ is very hot and I was very concerned about heat/cool loss through the dog door. Even in 110 plus temps I cannot feel any heat transfer through the plastic panes. This does an excellent job at keeping the heat out. It was extremely easy to install. I was able to get the whole thing done in about an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Briese

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It really does help keep the drafts out! We had a sliding door panel door prior to this, and the difference is drastic. My only reason for not giving 5 stars is that the flaps sometimes get caught inside the frame, then a breeze can blow it around and it gets a little noisy. A good product, and would purchase again. Note: when they say super large, that is no joke! Even our big boys fit easily through this; it is much larger than I had expected, even knowing the dimensions prior to ordering. BIG!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great door
customer_reviews.text: Great pet door, easy to install. Cheaper here than the big box. I’ve installed several of these and they pop right in place. Client changed directions at the last second so I ended up returning this one.
customer_reviews.author: Nic A.

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Pet Door; Smaller than Expected.
customer_reviews.text: Finally got around to installing this dog door and while I must say the quality and ease of installation is second to none, however, for the price, an Extra Large door should be bigger than this. We have a 65 pound Husky/Shepherd mix, and he fits thru this door, but just barely. I was a bit disappointed that this door was not larger than it was. Shame on me for not looking at the measurements on the description, and doing my due diligence in marking the door prior to purchase, but Extra Large should be bigger than this. Overall, I am satisfied with this door and highly recommend it. Just make sure you know what you're getting.
customer_reviews.author: HeadOfTeamSmiley

customer_reviews.title: First two were wonderful - sealed tight and kept the cold out
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd time I have purchased this door. First two were wonderful - sealed tight and kept the cold out. I have been very disappointed in this newest door. From day one there was a small gap between the bottom of the flaps and the magnetic strip. I tried adjusting the flaps but didn't help. Now that it is really cold, the flaps have frozen and won't even close at all- they just stick straight out until we manually push them down.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Good but bulky
customer_reviews.text: We have two dog doors, this product and also a "Security Boss" dual-flap dog door. This does the job and is less expensive. Make sure not to install this near a lever type door knob as it sticks out several inches and will obstruct the operation of the lever. The "Security Boss" dog door is more expensive but much better quality (aluminum), better durability, better quality flaps, and looks so much better, it's not bulky at all and is just a better dog door all around. If all you want is a functioning dog door that blocks out the weather and may need replaced after a couple of years (thin plastic), this is what you get here.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I went with this one
customer_reviews.text: I debated getting this door vs another that cost three times as much. I'm glad I went with this one. Super easy install and the directions are idiot-proof. The magnetic double flap system works amazingly well and there is no draft. I recommend running a thin bead of silicone around the edges inside, outside and the overlapping seam between the inside and outside pieces (all the way around, between the flaps) but that is almost overkill. My dog is a 32 pound border collie and the extra large is a perfect size for her.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: nice quality!
customer_reviews.text: This door is such a giant improvement over my last single flap "doggie door". I think I had to order an XL because they don't have a large, it was still smaller than my last door (about 4 inches narrower and 2 inches shorter). My 35# wheaten can still fit through it easily (she is tall but narrow), but it's too narrow for a person to fit through. This will hopefully keep us much warmer in the winter, my last one would swing right out at the slightest breeze which was not great for a New England winter.
customer_reviews.author: Ima Reader

customer_reviews.title: well-built and efficient
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Ruff-Weather pet door I've purchased (multiple installation locations, not replacements), and they are great. Our first installation is going on 7 years old, and it's still awesome. You just need to clean it occasionally. I never feel a draft near it. The Medium size is perfect for our 40lb sheltie (a *large* sheltie ?mix?). You wouldn't imagine he could fit through it, based on the flap size specs, but he barrels though the door at break-neck speed out to the backyard, so it must be plenty big. The Small size is perfect for our cat, without allowing the sheltie access to cat-only areas.
customer_reviews.author: jesswood

customer_reviews.title: Good cat door
customer_reviews.text: My cat is 14.5 pounds, so I ordered a medium first. The wall in which I needed to install it wasn't wide enough so I exchanged for a small, and he fits fine. This is a good item that keeps out wind and dust, and my cat uses it easily. I like that it comes with a sliding cover so I can easily keep him inside when I am away from home and at night. One complaint -- not about this product -- is that Amazon should consider free shipping both ways. Very annoying to have to pay twice, at least when one is a profitable customer.
customer_reviews.author: mosi123

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install. Blows open in winter.
customer_reviews.text: Was very happy with the product when I first installed it last spring. It was very simple to install in a paneled door. But now it's constantly being blown open by winter winds and I might as well have a big hole in the side of my house. I can hear it opening when the wind blows and then cold air is just pouring into my kitchen. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H

customer_reviews.title: Great quality easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Let me just say this dog door is extremely high-quality very very pleased with this purchase and will be purchasing another one. Quality like I said is top notch very easy to install with a jigsaw and a drill. More than happy. I purchased a cheaper one hoping to save some money about a month ago ended up returning it and buying this One. I am sure happy I did our dog loves it too and it keeps the heat out side in the nice cool air inside. This definitely helps living in Phoenix Arizona.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Nice product- recommended
customer_reviews.text: Installed this product along with the expander in a wall. The instructions and templates were very helpful and I was able to get it installed in about an hour, including the time for cutting the hole in the wall. It seems sturdy and after a couple of months of use we've had not problems. Was worried about it allowing drafts in the winter but even during a cold snap with temps below 10 degrees f we did not feel any draftiness. A friend noticed the door and based on our recommendation bought one and in helping him install it we had the same smooth experience. Went in without any problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tboy

customer_reviews.title: My two big dogs love it.
customer_reviews.text: My two large dogs (german shepherd and bernese mtn dog) took a few hours to get used to this door, but after that it's been superb. They come and go all day long as they please. No sign of wear yet on the door flaps and this is over 6 months of heavy use by two big dogs! And they're not gentle with dog doors, often racing inside! I did use a clear outdoor silicone to seal around the door, that's definitely something to do after installation for a waterproof installation.
customer_reviews.author: Toonpaw

customer_reviews.title: Install through a door is easy and can be done in 30 min with a ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a life saver. I've installed this in my Last 3 houses. This last time i had to go through the wall. Buy the extension kit if you are going through the wall and save yourself some time and headache. Install through a door is easy and can be done in 30 min with a sawsall and drill. The dogs act like they dont know how to use it every time i install one but after a day or 2, they are running through it full speed with things they shouldn't have like underwear and my daughter's snacks.
customer_reviews.author: Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy duty doggie door.  Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: My puppies love this. Installing through my exterior wall was a bit of challenge and I had to purchase longer bolts. The door is super heavy duty and looks great installed. It’s really made to install through a garage door. But worked ok through the wall. Works great for our pittbull terrier. Perfect size for her.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Works great and was fairly simple to install.
customer_reviews.text: This extra large is just big enough for my 75lbs Lab. The double flaps work great to keep the heat and draft out. I was worried my Lab would have a hard time learning to use a doggie door, but no troubles at all. I think because the flaps are see thru, helped my dog to be fearless going thru because he could see outside the door. It took me about an hour to install. I am a beginner diy'er and did not encounter any problems. It fit perfect on the first cut!
customer_reviews.author: Bogeyman

customer_reviews.title: This is a great doggie door
customer_reviews.text: This is a great doggie door. We have one installed in our back door and one in our shed. It is easy to replace or clean the flaps as needed. The older door has two solid panels which is great for securing the door close on both sides when no longer needed. This newer one only has one solid panel but if works on either side. The panel slides in from the top and is very secure.
customer_reviews.author: Gmafaye

customer_reviews.title: It’s a very nice door. Keeps the wind out
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very nice door. Keeps the wind out. The double door is a must! Stays closed even on very gusty days. The downfall....the weather striping is coming off and the magnetic strip on the bottom of the door broke off. I don’t see anywhere on this site to contact the seller so I can find a way to get this fixed. It definitely doesn’t stay closed like it used to. Thankfully it isn’t set into our house, but in our garage. It would be great if the seller would contact me.
customer_reviews.author: wyowoman

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to install and I'm no carpenter
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to install and I'm no carpenter. Straight forward instructions. Had a bad storm, thunder, lightning, wind and rain a few nights later. Not a drop of water made inside the door and that is without the sliding door in place. I have two full size German Shepard, one 120 lb, and the other 85 lb. They have no problem coming and going without scraping the sides or banging their legs. Very nice and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier!
customer_reviews.text: It took my dog a few hours to get used to the 2 flaps with the insert but now he loves it! My only complaint is when it is windy, the flaps do not stay in place, which allows warm air in the house and it makes an annoying loud clicking noise of the magnets hitting the plastic. Was kind of a pain to install but worth it! My dog is 14 lbs, I got the medium and it is the right size, smaller would not have worked. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya T

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended by unbiased client
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this item; I used it to replace a High Tech door that operated with the electronic collars. Although in theory a great idea, in practice, got tired of always having to purchase batteries, replacement collars (they break apart really easily) and dealing with the door sticking when the weather turns cold. This Ideal Pet Products door was a breeze to install and provides a nice barrier against the outside weather. The dogs both adjusted quickly to having to push the flaps open and I'm happy knowing I will not have to purchase additional items in the future. I would highly recommend this product to any potential buyers...I am not reimbursed in any way for this endorsement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: said that it was the best doggie door he'd ever seen and was going to ...
customer_reviews.text: Contractor who installed this for me, said that it was the best doggie door he'd ever seen and was going to purchase one himself. I used the extra wall kit, too. I installed the door in a wall of the living room leading to the back yard; and you never even notice it. Looks like it's always been there.
customer_reviews.author: dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: replaced a single flap design
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this item. Will be interesting to see how long it stands up to the Florida heat and weather, previous door was aluminium. But this for did drip my chilling bill by $20 a month VS the single flap design. Super strong magnets to keep it closed. Took dogs a few days to get used to the dual flaps, but they figured it out when they had to pee bad enough.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice if the doors would close completely
customer_reviews.text: Does the job in warm weather. But as another reviewer complained - the thick plastic flaps don't close completely during cold weather....pretty much defeating the whole purpose of a weather-proof door. In reality it makes the situation worse by allowing the cold air to blow through the gap - in my case up to an inch or more. Maybe I'll try attaching a metal weight or something to the bottom of the flap, I don't know. Something to think about before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ZRRIFLE

customer_reviews.title: Magnets don’t work. Think twice before hacking your door..
customer_reviews.text: After spending a half a day installing this dog door and destroying my door to my home by cutting a large hole, I did complete the project fairly pleased, but slightly apprehensive. The following day after my dog got the hang of going through both flaps I noticed that the magnetic closure system did not work properly. The magnet does not effectively pull the flap up to a complete closure leaving a gap for the cold winter weather to blow in to my home. I don’t understand how The company that sells these claims that these flaps are made to withstand 30 mile hour winds?? I got to say I’m pretty disappointed :-(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable and very insulated.  Works well with Cincinnati weather!
customer_reviews.text: We installed this last fall and we absolutely love it. We have 3 medium dogs who love to chase each other in and out of the house and the flaps have held up with out signs of damage. I have been prepared to replace the flaps due to others comments but so far no signs that it will need to be done. The only negative is: On both sides of each flab there is weather stripping and 1 strip from the front flap and 1 strip from the back flap has come out and will not stay in. We will need to come up with some sort of solution before winter hits since our winters go below zero.
customer_reviews.author: K. Masterson

customer_reviews.title: Great doggie door
customer_reviews.text: My little doxie, 10# and Welsh terrier 16# both use this door. It does a good job of sealing out cold/hot weather. My husband put it in without any hitches. Our door is paneled at the bottom and this was not a problem, also the door is steel. The dogs started with one flap (we taped up the second flap) then progressed to the second flap. Both dogs use it fine. I like the closure door as we have raccoons that visit our back step, so having it secure at night is important to us. Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper in Millville

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for extreme weather and energy saving
customer_reviews.text: This is the pet door you want if you have extreme weather, or if you are trying to be green and save on your utility bill. Around here we get 100 degree days in the summer and -20 degree nights in the winter, plus the occasional tornado. This door, with the double seal, keeps the extreme weather outside. The cats prefer this to their previous little door: because the flaps are crystal clear, they can see what's on the other side before they venture out. And my dog loves having her own door!
customer_reviews.author: Foodie

customer_reviews.title: We and the dog are very well satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: This pet door is great! It's easy for the dog to use, and it is exceptionally good at keeping out the hot weather. So far the flaps have stayed very clear without any paw scratches. The installation instructions were complete and easy to follow, so that the door was a perfect fitl
customer_reviews.author: Barb Mid

customer_reviews.title: This is the best one to date and very well made - the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used dog doors for over 12 years now, many different brands, and my dogs are brutal on them. This is the best one to date and very well made - the double flaps seal pretty well for decent weather proofing. I have mine for a basement door to the outside, and I wouldn't recommend it for use into a main floor room as all dog doors are somewhat drafty, but its perfect for the basement or into a room that could take some drafts.Easy installation too - just tweak the plastic flaps so they swing and sit well by adjusting the supporting screws. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Great door
customer_reviews.text: I'll start by saying, if you're going through a wall, with vinyl siding, you will need the extension kit. Because of the uneven surface of the siding, I removed it, and made a wood frame for inside the house, and sealed the outside with silicone. It seems to insulate pretty well, even with one flap removed. I do have a wind barrier around my deck, but it isn't insulated. It was -10 degrees here in New York, and it wasn't horrible by the door. It would have been much warmer with both flaps, but my Boston was having issues with the 2 flap system. Both animals got it down within a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Seanachain

customer_reviews.title: Great Pet Door! Works perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Installed perfectly, directions were great. The company has YouTube videos you can watch. This helped me very much. Looks great, and gives our pets a new freedom that they love.
customer_reviews.author: David Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Great all weather door...
customer_reviews.text: I like this allot. i used it in my wall and did not purchase the wall extension. i just cut some wood and used than in between the entrance and exit. magnetic flaps are real strong and hold up well with high wind. I have three dogs ranging from a chihuahua to an american bull dog and all of them go through with no problems. The chihuahua has a little trouple opening the flaps because of the magnets but she gets it ok..
customer_reviews.author: CaliBandit

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and functional - but beware installation instructions
customer_reviews.text: If you are purchasing this item, strongly recommend you read the installation tips in other reviews - without those this probably would have gotten 2 stars. I also purchased the installation kit and had someone who does construction install for me. I think it actually looks better installed than it does in the picture. My GSD wasn't impressed at first - with the double flaps, took quite a few times of coaxing and bribing to convince her this was a good idea, but other visiting dogs have followed her right in or out. Does a much better job of insulating than the single flap model I had before.
customer_reviews.author: LadyExec

customer_reviews.title: I felt terrible having my dog stuck in the house all day
customer_reviews.text: I needed this badly! I felt terrible having my dog stuck in the house all day. Now he can go in and out when he pleases whether we are home or not. It is a heavy door flap, so getting my dog to go through it took some training. Now he uses it to poke his head out to see if it is raining before he goes outside! This has reduced the number of flies in the house as the magic screen couldn't handle my dog barreling through it!
customer_reviews.author: Mike A

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! My two dogs learned to use it in about 2 days, and I couldn't be any happier with it (neither could they). I would say it probably took me about an hour from start to finish to remove the main door, cut the hole, install the pet door, and reinstall. And that is with me taking my time to make sure i made a good cut in a metal door. Love he double plastic flaps, magnetic catches at the bottom. Keeps conditioned air in while allowing the doge to go out as needed. I definitely recommend, and wish I would have bought it sooner!!
customer_reviews.author: ironcross26

product_meta.title: Ideal Pet Products Ruff-Weather Pet Door with Telescoping Frame
product_meta.description:
Size:Super Large - 15" x 23.5" Flap SizeWhether you’re in a place with endless summers or harsh winters, we have the right pet door for your Ideal Pet. Our Ruff-Weather™ Pet Door was designed to handle all types of climate conditions, while boasting great energy efficiency, thanks to this door’s double flap feature! 

Features:
Structural foam plastic frame that adapts to doors ranging from 3/4" to 1-3/4" in thickness
Energy efficient Double Vinyl Flap design creates 3 inch air pocket for maximum insulation
Optional pet door Wall Kit is designed for installation in walls from 4-3/4” to 7-1/4” thickness, sold separately
By Ideal Pet Products
feature_bullets: Overall Dimension: 18 15/16" x 28 1/2". For pets 91 to 120 Lbs
Structural foam plastic frame that adapts to doors ranging from 3/4" to 1-3/4" in thickness
Energy efficient Double Vinyl Flap design creates 3 inch air pocket for maximum insulation
Weatherseal & Nylon Window Pile for added insulation

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
